column4: anyone here have any experiece with mounting ecryptfs files that were orphaned by fsck? Details @ http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/rQ9xrW2j
been there done that :D  you need your key though
you can use the ecryptfs tools to reconsruct it using your pwd. I've done that much before
cool as then, got some links in my email will dig them out
same routine then with the ones in lost and found, just copy them somewhere and work on them there
when fsck orphaned my stuff, it messed up all the file names as well.
ah, luckily its not the file names that matter, you checked for the .Private dir in your old /home (not user) folder I guess ?
I could probably make a fair guess as to which one was my .Private directory though. Are there any other key files that matter?
thats actually your files, there stored there
is .Private a directory or a file?
kind of anyway, try reading this, its comprehensive http://wikinewbie.wordpress.com/2010/08/16/rm-rf-ext4ecryptfs-undelete/
not good. I don't have any orphaned directories that are any where near the right size.
goog luck, remember to image / backup files first, im out
